summary: This bill, the Public Service Freedom to Negotiate Act of 2025, aims to secure the rights of public employees to organize, collectively bargain, and engage in concerted activities, safeguarding the public interest and promoting commerce. It establishes federal minimum standards, requires the Federal Labor Relations Authority to determine if state laws meet these standards, and provides for enforcement through the Authority and courts. The bill also addresses lockouts, strikes, and existing agreements, while outlining exceptions and authorization of appropriations.
